page.title: 01Belchamp Otten Bel. Walter
page.content: The twelve kilometer rectangle covers the larger part of the parishes of Belchamp Walter and Belchamp Otten, and small parts of Borley and Bulmer in the county of Essex. Belchamp Walter, Belchamp Otten and Borley were mentioned in the first Domesday Survey. There are records of another village, Belchamp St. Ethelberts which disappeared in the middle ages, situated near Belchamp Otten, who's church is named for St. Ethelbert. The area is undulating boulder clay, used for arable farming and transversed by two tributaries of the stour/Belchamp Brook and an unamed tributary. {Belchamp Hall. Belchamp Walter. {Eight Bells Public House & P.O. {Church of St. Ethelberts and All {Saints. Belchamp Otten Church of St {Mary the Vigin. Belchamp Walter { }
